questions.question_text: A security analyst has identified malware that is propagating automatically to multiple systems on the network. Which of the following types of malware is MOST likely impacting the network?

choices.B: Do not run any of the software and notify the organization's cybersecurity office. The open-source website has been compromised, and none of the software can be trusted.
choices.A: Download and run the software but notify the organization's cybersecurity office. The malware registry has a false positive since the software has been running without any issues.
choices.C: Download and run only webserver_82.exe and opendatabase_44.exe and notify the organization's cybersecurity office. Legacy versions of the software have been compromised.
choices.D: Do not run webserver_82.exe and notify the organization's cybersecurity office. The software is malware.

comments.content:
"Do not run any of the software" that why B would be wrong. The other programs do not match known malware signatures.
D is correct

discussion.content: i'm not saying D is incorrect but why is B wrong?

choices.B: One Unified Communications Certificate and one wildcard certificate
choices.C: One wildcard certificate and two standard certificates

questions.question_text: An administrator needs to protect five websites with SSL certificates. Three of the websites have different domain names, and two of the websites share the domain name but have different subdomain prefixes. Which of the following SSL certificates should the administrator purchase to protect all the websites and be able to administer them easily at a later time?

discussion.content:
Yes B
Unified Communications Certificate (UCC) is a type of multi-domain certificate used in SSL authentication. It allows for the inclusion of multiple domain names and host names within a domain in one certificate. A Unified Communications Certificate is also known as a Storage Area Network (SAN) Certifica

A SAN certificate, which stands for subject alternative name, refers to an SSL/TLS certificate that secures multiple domains under one certificate. Rather than having to purchase a separate single domain SSL certificate for each domain individually, you can purchase one comprehensive certificate that covers multiple domains simultaneously.

Subject Alternative Name (SAN) is not so much a type of certificate as a special field in X.509. It allows you to specify additional items (IP addresses, domain names, and so on) to be protected by this single certificate.
The complexity of the network is in need to specify each certificate: SAN can fix that

Pen test is mually vs venerability test is used software
Penetration testing exploits a vulnerability in your system architecture while vulnerability scanning (or assessment) checks for known vulnerabilities and generates a report on risk exposure.

Answer is correct -

Vulnerability scanning - is an automated scan, looks for known vulnerabilities in your systems and reports potential exposures.

Penetration test - detailed hands-on examination by a real person that tries to detect and exploit weaknesses. find exploitable flaws and measure the severity

questions.question_text: A security administrator begins assessing a network with software that checks for available exploits against a known database, using both credentials and external scripts. A report will be compiled and used to confirm patching levels. This is an example of:

discussion.content:
D is correct
With secure LDAP (LDAPS), all LDAP communications are encrypted with SSL/TLS, and port 636 is used.
Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is a standardized directory access protocol that allows queries to be made of directories
SFTP-Secure File Transfer Protocol and Secure Copy both secure file transfer but they secure with SSH (Secure Shell)

comments.content: The question states "between directory servers" indicating LDAP. Because they were able to sniff the traffic, you want to implement LDAPS or LDAP with SSL.

questions.question_text: A company recently contracted a penetration testing firm to conduct an assessment. During the assessment, the penetration testers were able to capture unencrypted communication between directory servers. The penetration testers recommended encrypting this communication to fix the vulnerability. Which of the following protocols should the company implement to close this finding?
